content: Egypt raised fuel pricesBloomberg Terminal by as much as 13%, in the latest move to trim state subsidies in line with International Monetary Fund-backed reforms. The diesel price was lifted by almost 13% to 17.5 Egyptian pounds ($0.37), effective Friday, the oil ministry said in a statement. The prices of 95-, 92- and 80-octane types of gasoline were increased from 10.5% to 12.7%. Prices will remain unchanged for at least a year, the ministry said.

content: Malaysia’s growth unexpectedly accelerated in the third quarter, with the economy firing across all sectors and exports defying US President Donald Trump’s imposition of higher tariffs. Gross domestic product rose 5.2% in the July-September period from a year earlier, according to advance estimates from Malaysia’s Department of Statistics on Friday. That’s faster than even the highest estimate in a Bloomberg survey, and exceeds the pace of expansion seen in the previous three quarters.

Treasury Five-Year Yield Falls to Lowest Since October 2024 reflects economic forces that could influence investor behavior and market stability. The implications extend to both domestic and international financial markets.
content: Five-year Treasury yields dropped to a one-year low as concerns surrounding US regional banks and lingering trade tensions fueled a flight to safety. The yield declined as much as three basis points to 3.51%, the lowest since early October 2024. The move came after two-year US yields sank to levels last seen in 2022 and the benchmark 10-year yield fell below the 4% mark.

description: This market development indicates significant shifts in financial sentiment and trading patterns. Copper Declines on Concerns Over Credit and US-China Tensions reflects economic forces that could influence investor behavior and market stability. The implications extend to both domestic and international financial markets.
content: Copper and other industrial metals retreated on concerns about credit quality in the US and renewed tensions between Washington and Beijing. The metal, seen as a bellwether for the global economy given its widespread industrial use, fell 0.7% on the London Metal Exchange on Friday. That pared the week’s gain to 0.4%, after it touched $11,000 a ton the prior week — the highest intraday level since May 2024 — on supply concerns.

title: Singapore’s Swap Rates Are Set to Rise From a Three-Year Low
description: This market development indicates significant shifts in financial sentiment and trading patterns. Singapore’s Swap Rates Are Set to Rise From a Three-Year Low reflects economic forces that could influence investor behavior and market stability. The implications extend to both domestic and international financial markets.
content: Traders are betting that Singapore’s swap rates will need to rise to offset an expected weakening of the currency. The city-state’s dollar is around the lowest levels in five months versus the greenback, which may put upward pressure on local rates. The central bank is also less likely to pump liquidity in the near-term, according to analysts. And while in the past Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts would help lower Singapore rates too, that link has broken down.

title: Fed Staff Query Missing $1.4 Trillion Hedge Fund Treasuries Pile
description: This market development indicates significant shifts in financial sentiment and trading patterns. Fed Staff Query Missing $1.4 Trillion Hedge Fund Treasuries Pile reflects economic forces that could influence investor behavior and market stability. The implications extend to both domestic and international financial markets.
content: Hedge funds in the Cayman Islands held more Treasuries at end-2024 than US official data show, with their ownership likely to be $1.4 trillion higher than reported, according to researchers at the Federal Reserve. The funds’ holdings had increased by $1 trillion since 2022 to reach $1.85 trillion by end-December, the researchers including Daniel Barth and Daniel Beltran wrote in an Oct. 15 note. A report from the Department of the Treasury put the funds’ ownership at $423 billion.
